title: CBSE to teach AI from Class 3: Are the guardrails ready?

content: The Ministry of Education has announced that Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Computational Thinking (CT) will become mandatory subjects from Class 3 onwards starting in the 2026–27 session. The initiative, aligned with NEP 2020 and NCF SE 2023, aims... [9079 chars]

title: Explained: Did PewDiePie's AI chatbots really rebel against him? Truth behind viral 'Council' experiment
description: YouTuber PewDiePie's artificial intelligence experiment took a dramatic turn. He created an AI council to answer questions. When some bots failed, he threatened deletion. This led to the AI system rebelling against him. The situation escalated into a digital standoff. PewDiePie's tech venture became a surprising conflict.

title: A month without data muddles the economic picture
description: Tariffs are at their highest rates in decades. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers are going without paychecks. Artificial intelligence is threatening to reshape the American workforce.

title: West Bengal Police to tie up with AI to curb crimes in state
description: The West Bengal Police have decided to tie up with Artificial Intelligence (AI) to curb crimes, said a police source on Saturday. An AI cell is going to be formed in the police department.
content:
The West Bengal Police have decided to tie up with Artificial Intelligence (AI) to curb crimes, said a police source on Saturday. An AI cell is going to be formed in the police department.

title: South Korea, Singapore sign MOUs on AI, green shipping: President Jae Myung
description: South Korea and Singapore agreed to work together on artificial intelligence, green shipping, and defence technology. The agreements were confirmed by President Lee Jae Myung and Prime Minister Lawrence Wong after their summit in Seoul, highlighting closer ties between the two nations.

title: South Korea and Singapore Forge New Path in AI and Green Shipping
description: South Korea and Singapore have signed key agreements to collaborate on artificial intelligence and green shipping. In a bilateral summit held in Seoul, both nations also pledged to work closely on advancing defence technology, aiming to strengthen their strategic partnerships.

title: Two-day seminar on ‘Exploring AI through Dogri’ begins at MIET Jammu
description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Nov 1: Model Institute of Engineering and Technology (MIET), Jammu, inaugurated a two-day seminar, titled “Exploring Artificial Intelligence through Dogri: Opportunities for Language, Culture, and Local Development in Jammu & Kashmir”, under the Vibrant Advocacy for Advancement and Nurturing of Indian Languages (VAANI) scheme of AICTE. The seminar brought together distinguished academicians, researchers, and professionals to deliberate on the intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and regional language empowerment, with a focus on Dogri. The event featured six […]

title: Need to Rejuvenate Basic Science in the Age of AI
description: Biju Dharmapalan and Shivaprasad Amaravayal bijudharmapalan@gmail.com We are living in an AI-inspired world where human beings’ daily activities are influenced by the endless powers of artificial intelligence. AI is capable of reading human speech, producing creative works like poetry, writing and even movie making, diagnosing diseases, and even predicting the folding of proteins with astounding precision. Even in the education sector, AI has become an indispensable component. Basic science, which is the fundamental quest of understanding nature, is being relegated […]
